meanings.definition: Make (a room or building) resistant to the passage of sound.
meanings.sent1: She soundproofs her room by adding thick curtains to block outside noise.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew soundproofs the walls of the recording studio to ensure high-quality sound.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tries to soundproof its meows by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: His determination to soundproof his mind against distractions helped him focus on his studies.
meanings.sent5: The soundproofed walls embraced her with a comforting silence.

meanings.definition: A material or structure that blocks the transmission of sound.
meanings.sent1: The soundproofs installed in the conference room kept discussions private.
meanings.sent2: The soundproofs in the headphones allowed him to enjoy music without disturbance.
meanings.sent3: The soundproofs in the library whispered secrets to each other when no one was around.
meanings.sent4: The soundproofs of the fortress shielded it from the enemy's eavesdropping.
meanings.sent5: The soundproofs created a barrier of tranquility in the midst of chaos.
